intro: Perianthostelma, commonly known as the perianthostelma, is a specialized plant structure found in certain flowering plants. It refers to the fused tissues of the perianth (which includes sepals and petals) and the stelma, which is the central part of the flower's reproductive structures. This fusion creates a unique floral morphology that can vary in complexity among different species. The perianthostelma often plays a role in protecting the reproductive organs and may also be involved in pollination mechanisms. Its presence and structure can be used as a taxonomic feature in plant classification.
